Class Stack<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Stack<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StackInterface<T>

    public class Stack<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements StackInterface<T>

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Stack()
      The constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Removes all elements in the stack using a loop.
      int getSz()
      getter for the size of the stack
      boolean isEmpty()
      This method tells us if the stack is empty or not.
      T peek()
      The peek() method will return the first element on the stack.
      T pop()
      The remove method for stack, "pops" off the top value.
      T popTop()
      Another remove method for stack, "pops" off the top value, but also gives an exception if stack is empty.
      void push(T newEntry)
      Adds new entry to the top of the stack

    • Constructor Detail

      • Stack

        public Stack()
        The constructor. Creates a new stack, initially with no values yet.

    • Method Detail

      • getSz

        public int getSz()
        getter for the size of the stack
        Returns:
        size of stack, sz

      • push

        public void push(T newEntry)
        Adds new entry to the top of the stack
        Specified by:
        push in interface StackInterface<T>
        Parameters:
        newEntry - the element you are adding to the stack, T

      • pop

        public T pop()
        The remove method for stack, "pops" off the top value.
        Specified by:
        pop in interface StackInterface<T>
        Returns:
        T, the item that is being deleted: the first element on the stack before it was deleted.

      • peek

        public T peek()
        The peek() method will return the first element on the stack. This is done by simply by pulling the 'data' of Node top.
        Specified by:
        peek in interface StackInterface<T>
        Returns:
        the top element on the stack.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        This method tells us if the stack is empty or not.
        Specified by:
        isEmpty in interface StackInterface<T>
        Returns:
        boolean, true if empty and top is null, false if objects are in the stack.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all elements in the stack using a loop.
        Specified by:
        clear in interface StackInterface<T>

      • popTop

        public T popTop()
         throws StackUnderflowException
        Another remove method for stack, "pops" off the top value, but also gives an exception if stack is empty.
        Specified by:
        popTop in interface StackInterface<T>
        Returns:
        T, the item that is being deleted: the first element on the stack before it was deleted, or StackUnderFlow Exception.
        Throws:
        StackUnderflowException
